episodeTitle: Usopp the Strongest? Leave the Negatives to Me
episodeTitleJapanese: ウソップ最強？ネガティブは任せとけ
episodeTitleEnglish: Usopp's the Strongest? Leave Anything Negative to Him!
description: When Perona's Negative Hollows overwhelm the Straw Hats with crushing depression, Usopp discovers his naturally pessimistic personality makes him immune to her powers. Meanwhile, Oars fashions a pirate hat from debris, and Absalom's forced wedding to Nami continues as the crew splits up to face different opponents.

events.title: Luffy's Group Approaches the Freezer
events.description: Luffy, along with Chopper and Robin, continue pursuing Gecko Moria through the castle corridors. Chopper informs them that if they keep going, they'll reach the freezer where Moria was last seen resting.
events.significance: Sets up the ongoing pursuit of Moria and establishes the castle's geography, particularly the freezer where Oars was kept.

quotes.text: If we keep going this way, we'll be in the freezer!
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper
quotes.context: Warning about their destination while pursuing Moria

events.title: Oars Creates a Pirate Hat from Debris
events.description: After being awakened with Luffy's shadow, the colossal zombie Oars grabs debris from the destroyed parts of the mansion and fashions it into a makeshift pirate bicorne hat for himself, mimicking Luffy's desire to be a pirate.
events.significance: Shows Oars adopting Luffy's personality and dreams despite being a zombie. This moment is both comedic and ominous, establishing Oars as a massive threat that shares Luffy's ambitions.

quotes.text: I'm gonna be King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars declaring Luffy's dream while wearing his makeshift pirate hat

events.title: Franky Creates a Corduroy Bridge
events.description: When the Straw Hats discover the stairs have been destroyed by Oars, Franky quickly constructs a corduroy bridge using materials at hand so the crew can cross and continue their mission.
events.significance: Demonstrates Franky's resourcefulness and engineering skills in a crisis situation, allowing the crew to continue pursuing their objectives despite obstacles.

events.title: Perona's Quarters Revealed
events.description: Zoro, Usopp, Sanji, and Franky reach Perona's elaborately decorated quarters filled with cute stuffed animals and gothic aesthetics, where they encounter the Ghost Princess herself.
events.significance: Introduces Perona's personal domain and sets the stage for the battle against her Negative Hollows.

quotes.text: You made it into my room... my patience is wearing thin.
quotes.speaker: Perona
quotes.context: Warning the Straw Hats who have invaded her quarters

events.title: Perona's Negative Hollow Overwhelms the Straw Hats
events.description: Perona demonstrates the terrifying power of her Horo Horo no Mi by sending her Negative Hollows through Zoro, Sanji, and Franky. The ghosts pass through their bodies, filling them with crushing negative thoughts that leave them unable to fight.
events.significance: Establishes the devastating psychological nature of Perona's Devil Fruit powers and shows even the strongest Straw Hats can be completely incapacitated by abilities that don't rely on physical combat.

quotes.text: If I were to be reborn, I'd like to be a clam.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro expressing extreme negativity after being hit by a Negative Hollow

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji succumbing to negative thoughts from Perona's ghost

quotes.text: I'm just a perverted hunk of scrap metal.
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky experiencing crushing self-doubt from the Negative Hollow

events.title: Usopp's Immunity to Negative Hollows Revealed
events.description: When Perona sends a Negative Hollow through Usopp, he remains completely unaffected, shocking everyone. Usopp reveals that he's naturally so negative and pessimistic about himself that the ghosts can't make him feel any worse than he already does.
events.significance: One of the most iconic moments in One Piece where Usopp's perceived weakness becomes his greatest strength. This reveals that mental state and self-perception can be a defense against certain Devil Fruit powers, similar to Luffy's rubber body vs Enel's lightning.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Explaining why Perona's powers don't work on him

events.title: Multiple Negative Hollows Backfire on Perona
events.description: Believing Usopp's immunity was a fluke, Perona sends four Negative Hollows through him simultaneously. Instead of affecting Usopp, his extreme negativity causes the ghosts themselves to become depressed, and Perona is shocked alongside her zombie servants.
events.significance: Further emphasizes that Usopp is Perona's natural enemy and that her supposedly invincible power has a fundamental weakness when faced with someone whose negativity exceeds even her ghosts.

events.title: Usopp Debuts Salt Star Technique
events.description: Usopp uses his new Salt Star technique, firing pellets filled with salt at Perona's zombie servants. The salt instantly purifies the zombies, causing their stolen shadows to return to their original owners.
events.significance: First appearance of Usopp's Salt Star attack, which exploits the zombies' critical weakness to salt. This technique proves essential in the battle against Thriller Bark's zombie army.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp calling out his new anti-zombie technique

events.title: Usopp Stays to Fight Perona Alone
events.description: After snapping Zoro, Sanji, and Franky out of their negative state, Usopp tells them to continue toward their objectives while he stays behind to face Perona and her forces alone, despite his fear.
events.significance: A major character moment for Usopp showing his growth and bravery. Despite being naturally cowardly and negative, he chooses to face a powerful opponent solo to protect his friends and their mission.

quotes.text: You guys go ahead! I'll handle this!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp volunteering to fight Perona while the others continue

events.title: Absalom's Wedding Ceremony Continues
events.description: While the Straw Hats battle throughout the mansion, Absalom's forced wedding to the unconscious, drugged Nami proceeds with zombie generals cheering. The ceremony is nearly complete as the priest rushes through the vows.
events.significance: Maintains tension by showing the parallel crisis of Nami's situation while emphasizing Absalom's villainy and the urgency for Sanji to reach her.

events.title: Chopper Prepares to Battle Hogback
events.description: Chopper, who had admired Dr. Hogback as a medical genius, prepares to face his former hero in battle after learning the truth about Hogback's twisted experiments with the dead.
events.significance: Sets up the emotional conflict of Chopper having to fight someone he once idolized, exploring themes of disillusionment and the corruption of scientific ethics.

events.title: Luffy Spots Moria in the Freezer
events.description: After running through the castle corridors, Luffy finally reaches the massive freezer and spots Gecko Moria resting inside, setting up their upcoming confrontation.
events.significance: Brings Luffy closer to his main objective of confronting Moria to get back the crew's shadows before sunrise.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Revealing his immunity to Perona's Negative Hollows

quotes.text: If I were to be reborn, I'd like to be a clam.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Under the effect of Perona's Negative Hollow

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Experiencing crushing negativity from Perona's ghost

quotes.text: You guys go ahead! I'll handle this!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

quotes.text: I'm gonna be King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Declaring Luffy's dream while wearing his makeshift pirate hat

themes.description: The episode's central theme shows how Usopp's natural negativity and low self-esteem, typically portrayed as character flaws, become his greatest asset against Perona's psychological attacks. What makes him 'weak' in conventional terms makes him uniquely powerful in this specific situation.
themes.symbolism: Usopp's immunity to the Negative Hollows symbolizes that every person has unique strengths, even in their perceived weaknesses. The ghosts passing harmlessly through him represents how acceptance of one's flaws can be a form of immunity to external judgment.
culturalReferences: Similar to Luffy vs Enel where Luffy's rubber body naturally countered Enel's lightning

themes.description: Perona's Devil Fruit represents a different kind of threat than physical combat - she attacks the mind and spirit. The episode explores how mental fortitude and self-perception can be just as important as physical strength in battle.
themes.symbolism: The Negative Hollows represent depression and self-doubt, showing how even the strongest warriors can be defeated by their own minds if they're not mentally prepared.

themes.description: Despite his natural cowardice and negativity, Usopp chooses to stay and fight Perona alone to protect his friends. The episode demonstrates that true bravery isn't the absence of fear, but acting despite it.
themes.symbolism: Usopp standing alone in Perona's room while his stronger crewmates move on symbolizes his growth as a warrior and his willingness to put the crew's needs above his own safety.

characterSpotlights.development: This episode showcases one of Usopp's most important moments in the series. His natural negativity, which has been a running gag throughout the series, is revealed to be a legitimate combat advantage. He also demonstrates genuine bravery by volunteering to fight Perona alone despite his fear.
keyActions: Remains unaffected by Perona's Negative Hollows
Causes Perona's ghosts to become depressed through his own negativity
Debuts the Salt Star technique against zombies
Volunteers to fight Perona alone while others continue their missions
Snaps Zoro, Sanji, and Franky out of their negative states
quotes: You guys go ahead! I'll handle this!

characterSpotlights.development: Perona's seemingly invincible Devil Fruit power is shown to have a fundamental weakness when faced with someone who is naturally more negative than her ghosts. Her shock and horror at finding a natural enemy adds vulnerability to her previously confident character.
keyActions: Demonstrates the devastating power of her Negative Hollows on Zoro, Sanji, and Franky
Discovers her power is completely ineffective against Usopp
Sends multiple Negative Hollows against Usopp, only to have them backfire
Commands her zombie servants to attack the Straw Hats
quotes: You made it into my room... my patience is wearing thin.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some of the scenes showing the Straw Hats' negative reactions to Perona's Hollows for comedic effect, particularly Zoro's 'clam' line and Sanji's apology.
Additional reaction shots from Chopper and other characters were added to emphasize the shocking nature of Usopp's immunity.

trivia.fact: Chapter 461, which this episode adapts, is titled 'Ghost Buster' - a reference to the famous Ghostbusters franchise.
This episode had a 6.4% TV rating in Japan and ranked 6th in its timeslot when it originally aired.
Usopp vs Perona is often compared to Luffy vs Enel (Episode 182-190) as both feature a Straw Hat with an innate immunity to a Devil Fruit power that seems unbeatable.
The 'Jungle P' opening used in this episode was one of the first One Piece openings to use the full-length song rather than a shortened version.
Kappei Yamaguchi, Usopp's Japanese voice actor, originally auditioned for the role of Luffy but was offered Usopp instead, which he accepted.
